The Office of Liquor and Gaming Regulation Queensland (OLGR) is the regulatory authority responsible for overseeing the liquor and gambling industries within the state of Queensland, Australia. It operates under the Department of Justice and Attorney-General, ensuring compliance with relevant legislation and promoting responsible gambling practices.

== Functions ==
The OLGR is tasked with a variety of functions aimed at regulating the gambling industry in Queensland. These include:

* Licensing and compliance for liquor and gaming establishments.
* Regulation of casinos, including The Star Gold Coast and Treasury Brisbane.
* Oversight of gaming machines and ensuring adherence to minimum return to player (RTP) requirements.

== Gaming Machine Regulation ==
The OLGR oversees the regulation of gaming machines, ensuring they meet the minimum RTP requirement of 85%. This ensures that a fair percentage of the money wagered is returned to players over time, promoting fair play and consumer protection.
